HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Mr. Ickes comes in with pain in his right
hip, left shoulder and for follow up of his coronary artery disease and
his left wrist.
His right hip continues to be painful at times. A radiogram in December
showed that he has osteoarthritis in that hip. He has been taking
Motrin twice a day and finds that he does get some relief with that.
His left shoulder has been bothering him for awhile but it is actually
is somewhat better than it has been. It hurts to abduct him more than
90 degrees or to reach behind his back.
His left wrist is bothering him some now. It is sore with most types of
motion.
Regarding his diabetes, his blood sugar today was 190 early this
morning.
Regarding his coronary disease, he has been walking every morning. He
has had no chest pain pressure or discomfort.
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION: Blood pressure is 110/70, weight is 192 pounds,
pulse is 70 and regular. He is a pleasant black man in no apparent
distress. Neck is supple without lymphadenopathy or thyromegaly. Chest
is clear to auscultation and percussion. Cardiac, S1, S2, regular rate
and rhythm, no murmurs or gallops. Abdomen is soft. Extremities,
without edema. Right hip, no pain with leg rolling. Left shoulder is
able to abduct to 90 degrees with no discomfort at all and is able to
abduct completely with only minimal discomfort. It is nontender to
palpation. Left wrist, he is a little tender over the medial joint
line.
ASSESSMENT AND PLAN:
1. Right hip: I think he has degenerative joint disease and I want him
to continue on the Motrin as needed.
2. Left shoulder: I may well have bursitis here. He feels this has
improved a lot and he would just as soon not do anything different
for now but will let me know if it causes more problems.
Ickes, Jr., William
81071628
02/02/79
Page 2
3. Left wrist: He probably also has some arthritis in his left wrist.
He is tender in the joint line today. It is bothering him a little
bit but not enough that he would like to do anything about it.
4. Coronary disease: He has been doing well from this prospective. He
has no recent chest pain, pressure or discomfort and his LDL has been
very well controlled.
5. Diabetes: His last hemoglobin A1c was slightly elevated and we will
check another one today. I will have him follow up with Olga in
PIMA regarding his diabetic control.
Larry Frantz, M.D.
